page.title: 13BINCKNOLL CASTLE.
page.content: {Bincknoll Castle}used to be an Iron Age stronghold. It would have had a wooden fence on top of the mounds. Huts might have been made from stone and straw. Now it has a lot of grass banks and there are only very little mounds because people have walked over it alot.If you stand on top of the hill you can see{Swindon}in the north east. On the{Ridgeway}above Bincknoll in the south east you can see the large hill fort called{BARBURY CASTLE You can find{BINCKNOLL CASTLE}by going along foot paths or bridleways from Broad Hinton, Broad Town, Wroughton,Salthrop, or Bincknoll farm just outside Wootton Bassett.
